messages.message:
Hi team - BofA is asking if Instabase uses Log4J. If it does, they need the version of log4j and the IB release if it does.

Can someone confirm as soon as possible? Looks like there’s a security threat going on so they’d like to get this addressed. Let me know this needs to be routed to a specific team. thank you!

https://instabase.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/2526
cc @Theo Jungeblut @shaunak in case other customers have already asked this :slightly_smiling_face:
let me check
I’m not 100% sure
Doesn’t look like it — the vulnerability is very scary
cc’ing @Heymian for table service and @Hari for pdf-service to to triple check
it is, if we can get confirmation from the other teams that would be great :pray::skin-tone-3:
@Kristine I looked through both the images and rescanned them.   The vulnerability: CVE-2021-44228 is not present in either one of them
wonderful - thank you!!

@Arora ji GS team is also checking on this, very likely to come up at other customers too. We should proactively communicate to the customers on potential impact and our action plan (if needed).

@shaunak @alagar @Theo Jungeblut- do we need to do any more due diligence to make sure that this vuln doesn’t impact Instabase? Thanks.

Hey @Varun Jain I ran scan on all the images that Instabase generates.  We don't have an issue in our images.  But, I think.there is an issue with elastic search which uses log4j for logging.  @sudeep can you look at it with the highest priority?
@sudeep in addition let's also look at the monitoring images.  I'm guessing they all use non java languages so we might be ok.
Hey @shaunak - yep most (i think all) monitoring images are go so we should be good on them. For elastic - we do not ship it to bofa so should be fine on that one too?
Yes, but we ship it to GS and NatWest
GS is also using managed elastic afaik
Got it, can we confirm?  What about NatWest?
Yep we do ship to natwest :)
Okay, let's get ahead of this.  What about jpmc?
@Varun Jain can you help us coordinate the messaging and shipping of these images?
JPMC uses its own internally blessed docker image
:thumbsup_all:
For GS i am reasonably sure as we built them SSO integration for search-service to support managed elastic. @Varun Jain @Arora ji - can you double check pls?
@sudeep let's sync over a brief call and discuss what we need here. Happy to connect when you can.
We can chat now
